709584f-a.text:
Sixth Ave. south from West 57th Street. Shown in the distance, is the Sixth Ave., Elevated, turning west on West 53rd Street.
About. 1922.
Brown Brothers.

709574f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, East side, North from 53rd Street.
June, 1925.

709576f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, West side, North from 53rd Street.
June,1925.

709582f-a.text:
Sixth Ave., east side, south from West 55th Street.  Prominent building shown on the N.E. corner of West 54th Street, is the Hotel Warwick. Also shown is the Sixth Ave., Elevated turning west on West 53rd Street.
About 1926.
Ewing Galloway.

709575f-a.text:
West side of Sixth Avenue, 53rd-54th Streets.
June 28, 1931.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

713657f-b.text:
West 53rd Street, east from a point east of Sixth Ave. and showing a clearance (incorporating Nos. 2 to 22) that adjoins the S.W. corner of Fifth ave. This may have been necessitated by subway construction which is progressing in the westerly portion of this block. On the opposite side, at the N.W. corner of Fifth Ave. is St. Thomas P.E. Church.. This set consists of three views, No. 2 and 3 emphasizing the aforementioned clearance. The latter is in a southwesterly direction to show the R.K.O. Building of Rockefeller Center across the roofs of buildings on the north
side of West 52nd Street.
November 22, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

713655f-a.text:
West 53rd Street, east from Sixth Avenue, showing at the left and right respectively, building at the N.E. and S.E. corners. The buildings to the rear of the latter are being removed to permit tunneling for the eastward curve of the Sixth Avenue line of the Municipal Subway. View 2 is photographed across the Avenue, from the west side of same. Note the portion of the R. K. O. Bldg. in Rockefeller City at the upper right.
April 20, 1939
August 3, 1940
P. L. Sperr

713655f-b.text:
West 53rd Street, east from Sixth Avenue, showing at the left and right respectively, building at the N.E. and S.E. corners. The buildings to the rear of the latter are being removed to permit tunneling for the eastward curve of the Sixth Avenue line of the Municipal Subway. View 2 is photographed across the Avenue, from the west side of same. Note the portion of the R. K. O. Bldg. in Rockefeller City at the upper right.
April 20, 1939
August 3, 1940
P. L. Sperr

713656f-b.text:
West 53rd Street, west from Sixth Avenue, showing this thoroughfare re-opened to view. The old Sixth Avenue "El" structure that formerly obliterated the view has
been removed.
March 11, 1939
April 20, 1939
P. L. Sperr

713656f-a.text:
West 53rd Street, west from Sixth Avenue, showing this thoroughfare re-opened to view. The old Sixth Avenue "El" structure that formerly obliterated the view has
been removed.
March 11, 1939
April 20, 1939
P. L. Sperr

713654f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, west side, south from W. 53rd Street, showing the locale partially freed of the obsolete "El" structure. Previously it turned westward on 53rd Street to join the 9th Avenue line at that Avenue. View 2 shows the street on its right. The third building site from the corner has already been cleared. Adjoining on the south are several tenements that are soon to come down. The latter will provide a site for a modern 6-story apartment house. Data for same is to he found in the New York Sun of March 19, 1939, the New York Times of January 7, 1940 and the Herald Tribune of January 21, 1940.
March 4, 1939
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr

713658f-a.text:
West 53rd Street, south side, west from (No. 48, left) a point slightly east of Sixth Ave. and across same, showing a clearance (former Nos. 56 to 62 inclusive) necessitated by subway construction. In the westerly end of this block, the now being constructed Sixth Ave. subway, will make a bend and veer eastward. Note the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line on the Avenue.
November 22, 1937.
L. Sperr.

713659f-a.text:
143-101 West 53rd Street, at, adjoining and west of the N.W.
corner of Sixth Ave.
October 22, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

709572f-c.text:
Sixth Avenue, west side, at W. 53rd Street as viewed northwestward from 52nd Street. Formerly this corner was darkened by the old 6th Avenue "El" which made a 90-degree bend to run west on 53rd Street. The vacant lot at the left has recently been cleared by the demolition of a 4-story frame building with a brick front. The adjoining 5-story tenement is being removed in Views 2 and 3.
This bears No. 1309 (old No. 927) Sixth Avenue.
At the left margin, in the later view, is the 6-story dwelling that is to be razed and its site improved by a modern apartment structure. This is to be the first major development on the avenue. For details and the architects' drawing--see New York Times of January 7, 1940 and the Herald Tribune of January 21, 1940 and the New York Sun of March 19, 1938.
View 1: March 4, 1939
View 2: April 20, 1939
View 3: April 20, 1939
P. L. Sperr

709573f-b.text:
(1)
Sixth Avenue, at the S.N. corner of . 53rd Street, showing the Sixth Avenue "El" turning westward on 53rd Street. The last train on this line was run at 10:30 P.M. Sunday, December 4, 1938; the city taking ownership as of December 5,
preparatory to the demolition of same.
March 19, 1938.
P.L. Sperr.
(2)
Another view of the same location photographed in a southwesterly direction from the N.E. corner of this point showing the last train on its northward trip rounding the bend. Across same appear buildings at the N.W. corner of 52nd Street which are to be demolished and their site improved with a modern apartment house. This is the first extensive improvement on this thoroughfare resulting from the "El" demolition.
March 1939.
Wm. Herries.

709567f-a.text:
(1)
Sixth Avenue, looking North from 53rd Street, showing
demolition of "L."
January 8, 1939.
(2)
Sixth Avenue, East side at West 5lst Street, looking Northwards to West Central Park. Medical Center buildings shown at the corner of West 67th Street and in distance Hotel.
P.L.Speer.  September 14, 1231.
